channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: In reversal, Warner Bros. jilts Netflix for Paramount
item.description: Warner Bros. says Paramount's sweetened bid to buy the whole company is "superior" to an $83 billion deal it struck with Netflix for just its streaming services, studios, and intellectual property.
item.content:encoded:
Warner Bros. says Paramount's sweetened bid to buy the whole company is "superior" to an $83 billion deal it struck with Netflix for just its streaming services, studios, and intellectual property.

(Image credit: Bloomberg/Bloomberg via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Iowa State's basketball star Audi Cooks is breaking records and topping score charts
item.description: She's from Iowa. She's a star female college basketball player. Her name is Audi Crooks. The junior at Iowa State University is a center who is known for her dominance on the court.
item.content:encoded: She's from Iowa. She's a star female college basketball player. Her name is Audi Crooks. The junior at Iowa State University is a center who is known for her dominance on the court.
item.dc:creator: Isabella Luu

item.title: The mayor of Buffalo, N.Y., blames ICE for the death of nearly blind refugee
item.description: The mayor of Buffalo, New York, is blaming ICE for the death of a man who was released from their custody. The man was blind and did not speak English. He was found dead days after his release.
item.content:encoded: The mayor of Buffalo, New York, is blaming ICE for the death of a man who was released from their custody. The man was blind and did not speak English. He was found dead days after his release.
item.dc:creator: Alex Simone

item.title: As Trump dismantles asylum programs, Russians and Ukrainians fear for future
item.description: The Trump administration has been sending asylum seekers from Ukraine and Russia back to a warzone. One family in Minnesota says they fear for their lives.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration has been sending asylum seekers from Ukraine and Russia back to a warzone. One family in Minnesota says they fear for their lives.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Crowded Democratic field could give GOP an opening in California governor's race
item.description: In California, the two candidates with the most votes in the primary advance to the general election, regardless of party. That's an issue for Democrats who have nine major candidates for governor.
item.content:encoded: In California, the two candidates with the most votes in the primary advance to the general election, regardless of party. That's an issue for Democrats who have nine major candidates for governor.
item.dc:creator: Guy Marzorati

item.title: How the Epstein file saga is fueling extremist conspiracies
item.description: Researchers of online extremism say lack of public accountability in relation to the release of the latest Epstein files has bred a worrying mixture of cynicism and nihilism in some online spaces.
item.content:encoded: Researchers of online extremism say lack of public accountability in relation to the release of the latest Epstein files has bred a worrying mixture of cynicism and nihilism in some online spaces.
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: Nvidia earnings, AI fan-fic, and the week in markets
item.description: Wall Street's AI worries are getting stranger. Chip company Nvidia reported record-breaking earnings on Wednesday, but tech investors are still panicking.
item.content:encoded: Wall Street's AI worries are getting stranger. Chip company Nvidia reported record-breaking earnings on Wednesday, but tech investors are still panicking.
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Bill Callahan's life was 'derailed' by having kids. Songwriting got him back on track
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with the singer-songwriter Bill Callahan about his new album My Days of 58.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with the singer-songwriter Bill Callahan about his new album My Days of 58.
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: Kyiv's elderly stay at home despite Russian attacks and power cuts
item.description: Older residents of Kyiv's many high-rises are learning to live with intermittent heat and electricity, cut off by Russian attacks.
item.content:encoded: Older residents of Kyiv's many high-rises are learning to live with intermittent heat and electricity, cut off by Russian attacks.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Jesse Jackson lies in repose
item.description: The official memorials for Jesse Jackson began this week. The late civil rights leader is lying in repose at his Rainbow-Push Coalition headquarters in Chicago Thursday and Friday.
item.content:encoded: The official memorials for Jesse Jackson began this week. The late civil rights leader is lying in repose at his Rainbow-Push Coalition headquarters in Chicago Thursday and Friday.
item.dc:creator: Cheryl Corley
